Params: Walking on the spacious streets of Constellia, a giant display board catches your eye.
Want to give it a shot?
Maybe skip the games this time?
Sure! Commandant, let's go check it out too!
Uh... "A Must-Watch Recommendation, 'To You in Winter,' a classic tear-jerking love story that made the whole world cry" seems to be the cinema's top pick!
I have a bad feeling about this just from the title.
Is it really okay to watch a tragic love story on Valentine's Day?
Let me see... looks like this is the only one with seats left.
This just got even more complicated.
How about we still try to find an arcade?
Sure, the intro said it's a classic movie from the Golden Age, gotta be fun!
The movie's about to start, Commandant. Let's hurry inside.
Kamui has bought two large buckets of popcorn, excitedly pulling you into a seat in the dimly lit cinema—the movie begins.
How could this be? I finally found you, and now you're just going to leave with him?
How could this be? I finally found you, and now you're just going to leave with him?
I won't let go of you again, even if leaving Wang Corporation means facing a harsh winter. We can weather it together!
I won't let go of you again, even if leaving Wang Corporation means facing a harsh winter. We can weather it together!
The two protagonists, accompanied by lines that scream classic, step into the snowfield, and in that moment, the dim cinema is illuminated by the snowy landscape.
You happen to see Kamui, holding popcorn, looking over at me.
He smiles in the dimming light.
The movie tries its best to make you cry, but the audience just walks out with blank faces.
Total bomb, that's what it is.
Commandant, I didn't know movies could be so interesting!
I figured once the main characters sort things out, they'd ride off into the sunset. Didn't expect a whole new challenge to pop up.
So we never get to see how it ends?
Enjoy? Not really, if we're talking about the actual story.
But hey, I think it's kind of cool this way too.
Kamui laughs, waving the two ticket stubs in the air.
Next time we have a chance, let's catch another movie!
Heard Golden Age audiences used to collect ticket stubs, so I'm going to keep these safe.
Once we watch a bunch of movies, we'll have our own special collection.
But hey, we don't have to just watch movies.
As long as I'm with you, Commandant, I'm happy no matter what we do.
